llm.feedback: World-class upgrade plan: restructure the draft into a tight, 3-scenario map (Baseline/Rollover, Limited/Verifiable Concessions, Escalation/Decoupling) with explicit triggers and invalidations and align time horizons to 0–45, 45–90, and 90–180 days; anchor probabilities to explicit bands (Base 60–70%, Alt A 20–30%, Alt B 20–30%) tied to concrete triggers such as expansion of export-control lists (0UOO8VW2V) or licensing outcomes (D5M2JYKVS) and magnet-policy shifts (SGB2PAZGK) with IDs after each fact; strengthen the causal chain by detailing how policy steps influence capex timing in domestic silicon/AI infra, supplier-credit re-pricing, and macro-risk premia that drive multiples, including at least two intermediate steps; fix potential conflicts by reconciling Nvidia’s ~15% revenue-share arrangement (D5M2JYKVS) with Intel’s ~10% CHIPS Act stake (I35H3FBSN) and explain how both feed Regime pressure; audit coverage to ensure all critical sources are used (IDs: 0UOO8VW2V, KFTWPFGAF, SGB2PAZGK, D5M2JYKVS, I35H3FBSN, NOTMRPS8C, OATKNJQ0E, 3ITAKK6XJ, M6M4LNMC4, 91HSMCZ7J); replace vague language with concrete watch items and dates (e.g., licensing updates within days, magnet-policy steps by Day 60, central-bank signaling windows) so the piece is testable under Base/Alt A/Alt B scenarios.
